page.title: 13MEMORIES FROM THE PAST
page.content: Today Dagenham is very built up area on the outskirts of London. It is very industrialised and built-up. It was'nt always like this in the past however, Dagenham was'nt always a part of London. An old resident of Dagenham described it like this:-"In 1925 the Church Elm pub,a little place,beside it was a narrow track,there were no pavements but there was white wooden fencing on either side. Into the distance stretched the open countryside with many old Elm trees and a few old cottages." The resident goes on to say that there were only a few shops about and also there was the Union Cable works in Chequers Lane which used to sound a siren . From 1926 onwards many people from London began to move to Dagenham.
